theorem Hancl3: fixes d ::"nat\<Rightarrow>real " and a b ::"nat\<Rightarrow>int " assumes "A > 1" and d:"\<forall>n. d n> 1" and a: "\<forall>n. a n>0" and b:"\<forall>n. b n>0" and "s>0" and assu1: "(( \<lambda> n. (of_int (a n)) powr(1 /of_int (2^n)))\<longlongrightarrow> A) sequentially " and assu2: "\<forall>n \<ge> s. (A/ (of_int (a n)) powr(1 /of_int (2^n)))> prodinf (\<lambda>j. d(n +j))" and assu3: "filterlim (\<lambda> n. (d n)^(2^n)/ b n) at_top sequentially" and "convergent_prod d" shows "suminf(\<lambda> n. b n / a n ) \<notin> Rats"
